content.webTitle: Alternative ways to travel along the Nile

fields.headline: Five more ways to travel along the Nile
fields.bodyText: · Step back in time on this six-cabin wooden sailing boat built in 1920 to ferry aristocrats up and down the river. Kuoni (01306 747008; kuoni.co.uk) offers five nights' full-board in a standard ensuite cabin and two nights' B&B in Luxor from £909 for departures in June 2008. Flights from Gatwick and transfers are included. · Few Nile cruise boats boast their own spa, swimming pool and gym. Launched in October, the 27-suite Oberoi Zahra also has a gourmet chef, Egyptologist and astronomer who will help you decipher the clear night skies. A seven-night cruise plus three nights at the Oberoi Mena House overlooking the Pyramids costs from £1,815pp with Cox & Kings (020 7873 5000; coxandkings.co.uk) and includes flights, seven nights onboard all-inclusive accommodation, four nights' B&B in Cairo plus private transfers . · Spend three nights sleeping on the deck of a traditional Felucca sailing boat as part of a 10-day tour with Explore (0844 499 0901; explore.co.uk). Visit the Pyramids and the Egyptian Museum at Cairo before an overnight train to Aswan where you'll board the boat for Luxor. The trip costs £681pp including flights some meals and accommodation. · Once owned by King Farouk of Egypt, this restored luxury steam ship SS Misr constructed by the Royal Navy in 1918 has 24 cabins and suites decked out in a number of styles including Ottoman and Art Deco. A seven-night trip with Voyages Jules Verne (0845 166 7003; vjv.co.uk) departing and returning to Aswan costs from £795pp in 2008 and includes flights, accommodation and full-board on the cruise. · Cycle from Aswan to Alexandria with Black Tomato (020 7610 9008; blacktomato.co.uk) on a 10-day trip. This challenging ride takes you across desert terrain, along the banks of the Nile, past ancient temples in Luxor and through the bustling streets of Cairo. Tailormade trips cost from £1999pp. Price includes flights, accommodation, support truck and guide. You need to bring your own bike.
